channel.title: Sweet Little Human
channel.description:
Poor Mother Nature. It's been a tough few thousand years. Tired and traumatized by relentless human expansion, they battle many of the ills that plague humans today: Addiction, anxiety, depression. And, of course, pure, cynical, unpredictable rage.
Their only solace? A good glass of whisky with their clumsy friend Mr.Bee.
But all is not lost. Mother Nature decides it's time to make a change. And what better way to tell a tragic story about humans but through yet another podcast?

item.title: Water is Wet... Dumbass
item.description:
Afsnit 5.
Three-quarters of the planet is covered with water, yet humans are still ignorant about the ocean. In this episode, Mother Nature sends two assistants to the Strait of Gibraltar to learn more about the big blue, but they are quickly distracted by fish, dolphins, and seasickness. Luckily, expert Professor Katherine Richardson can explain the ocean’s inextricable relationship to the climate and alarming updates on collapsing currents.

item.title: Man’s Best Friend
item.description:
Afsnit 4.
Mother Nature watches a video about a wolf tortured and killed in a bar, triggering a broader discussion about the return of the wolf worldwide. Can wolves and humans ever peacefully co-exist?
To find out, Mother Nature sends an assistant to Denmark to talk to nature enthusiast Sebastian Klein to learn more about the history of the wolf.
Meanwhile, freelance journalist Maya Tekeli updates Mother Nature on the hunt for Leonardo Dicaprio.

item.title: The Poor Bird Who Could Not Fly
item.description:
Afsnit 3.
This episode is dedicated to the extinct bird of the Great Auk – a symbolic story of biodiversity loss. However, their enthusiasm is interrupted when their angry editor calls, demanding more structure, focus, and less alcoholism in the program. Mother Nature reluctantly fills out a form, while the fate of the Great Auk mirrors a deeper crisis.

item.title: Fire Animals
item.description:
Afsnit 2.
Fire is one of humanity's most important discoveries – and also one of the most dangerous. In this episode, Mother Nature unfolds the history of fire and humans’ intertwined relationship with this element, from the first taste of cooked meat to the combustion engine and beyond.
Set in Tasmania, Australia, fire scientist David Bowman offers his perspective on the importance of fire and the future of humanity.

item.title: Bored to Death
item.description:
Afsnit 1.
Mother Nature is worried. Few people care about the climate crisis because “it’s so fucking boring”. Mother Nature calls renowned climate scientist Sir. David King to ask for help, but the conversation quickly falls into confusing metaphors and complicated statistics. It becomes clear:
If anybody is going to listen, they need to find a celebrity. But who?

item.title: Some Kind of Trailer
item.description:
Mother Nature is drinking whiskey and Mr.Bee is doomscrolling. Suddenly their editor calls to check if they’re ready for the premiere on September 22. Of course, they’re not.
